I think the answer to the question about whether we're seeing climate change is that the evidence is pretty clear that on average, we are seeing an increase in temperatures, and as temperature goes up, fire season usually becomes longer and oftentimes associated with bigger fires.
But there's nothing about the data on climate change to suggest what will happen on any given individual year.
We expect there will be wet years and dry years over the next century, even if there is an average increase in temperature.
